stem: Regarding the criteria for diagnosing Diabetes Mellitus, the following are true EXCEPT
opt1: FPG >=7.0 mmol/L plus 2 hour post 75g glucose >=11.1mmol is diagnostic
opt2: FPG <=5.5 mmol/L is normal fasting glucose
opt3: FPG >=7.0 mmol/L in an asymptomatic patient warrants another confirmatory test
opt4: 2 hour 75g glucose >=7.6 mmol/L and <11.1 mmol/L is impaired glucose tolerance
disc:
ADA criteria for diagnosing diabetes mellitus is:

- A fasting plasma glucose (FPG) level of 126 mg/dL (7.0 mmol/L) or higher, or

- A 2-hour plasma glucose level of 200 mg/dL (11.1 mmol/L) or higher during a 75-g oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT), or

- A random plasma glucose of 200 mg/dL (11.1 mmol/L) or higher in a patient with classic symptoms of hyperglycemia or hyperglycemic crisis, or

- A hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) level of 6.5% (48 mmol/mol) or higher
